 This method is called when the entire data set has changed, most likely through a call to Cursor#requery() on a Cursor.

Detailed Description

Receives call backs when a data set has been changed, or made invalid.

The typically data sets that are observed are Cursors. DataSetObserver must be implemented by objects which are added to a DataSetObservable. 

 // to inherit the class of DataSetObserver and implement virtual function.
 class SubDataSetObserver : public DataSetObserver
 {
 public:
   SubDataSetObserver(Page* page);
   ~SubDataSetObserver();
   virtual void onChanged();
   virtual void onInvalidated();
 };

 // In constructor, derived class needs to pass the parameter of page to base class
 SubDataSetObserver::SubDataSetObserver(gaia::core::Page* page)
  : DataSetObserver(page){}
 // new instance
 DataSetObserver* datasetObserver = new DataSetObserver(this); //this is page pointer
 // register in cursor
 cursor->registerDataSetObserver(*datasetObserver);
